translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of a Support
The Elder Ajinadāyaka’s Birth Story
“In the past, twenty-one eons ago,
I was a teacher of a group of people.
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
the receiver of offerings.
I gave a piece of skin
to the one with a topknot, the one who binds the world.
Because of that deed, O leader of men,
the best in the world, the bull among men,
I experienced perfection,
and I burned up the defilements.
I bear this last body
in the dispensation of the Buddha.

analyzed: ekattise itas kappe  ajinam yam adāsaha
translated: Twenty-one eons ago,🔽the hide I gave
I do not know of any bad destination,🔽this is the result of the hide.
Five eons ago,
I was a king who gave well,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful universal monarch.
The four analytical knowledges …
… the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”🔽Thus the elder Ajinadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ajinadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Ajinadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ dutiyaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ajinadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽ajinadāyaka therassa apadānam dutiya
translated: The Elder Ajinadāyaka’s Birth Story, the second.
